column2: WISCONSIN DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: WI

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column6: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column10: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 2. When following another vehicle at night, drivers should use:
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 3. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car approaching from the right.
column6: The car approaching from the left.
column8: The car that is traveling faster.
column10: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.

column2: 4. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column6: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05
column10: Even the smallest amount of alcohol

column2: 5. What does a flashing red light mean?
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right at next intersection
column6: No U-turns
column8: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column6: No turn on red

column2: 8. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column10: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 9. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver on the left.
column8: The last driver to reach the intersection.
column10: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.

column2: 10. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column6: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column8: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column10: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.

column2: 11. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column6: Warning signs

column2: 12. This white sign means you:
column4: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.
column6: may turn left only on a green arrow.
column8: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.

column2: 13. What does this sign indicate?
column6: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column10: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.

column2: 14. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column6: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.
column8: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column10: has no effect, they are different substances.

column2: 15. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 16. What does BAC stand for?
column6: Blood Alcohol Concentration

column2: 17. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column6: must turn into its left lane.
column8: must go to the next intersection.
column10: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 18. Driving at excessive speed:
column4: does not increase the chance of a crash.
column6: improves your reaction time.

column2: 19. This sign indicates:
column6: Warning: drunk drivers.
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column10: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 20. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column6: slow down before entering the curve.
column8: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.

column2: 21. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column6: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.
column10: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.

column2: 22. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column6: vehicles

column2: 23. The speed limit in outlying parts of cities with no posted speed limit is:
column6: 35 MPH

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn

column2: 25. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
column6: green, red and yellow.

column2: 26. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.
column6: it draws the attention of other drivers.
column8: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.

column2: 27. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the left curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column8: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.

column2: 28. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column6: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column8: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column10: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.

column2: 29. When you come to an intersection with a flashing red light, you must:
column4: slow down and drive carefully through the  intersection.
column6: stop only if cars are approaching the intersection.
column8: stop at the intersection and wait for a flashing green light.
column10: stop at the intersection, then proceed when safe and observe the right-of-way rules.

column2: 30. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the lane you’re in.
column8: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.

column2: 31. A single, dashed yellow line separating traffic means:
column4: Both lanes go in the same direction.
column6: Passing is not allowed.
column8: You may pass if it is safe to do so.

column2: 32. This sign indicates:
column6: Merging traffic

column2: 33. The driver is about to:
column6: turn right.

column2: 34. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column4: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.
column6: check your side view mirror.

column2: 35. Anything that requires you to _______ could cause you to crash.
column4: take your attention away from driving
column6: take your eyes off the road
column8: take your hands off the wheel

column2: 36. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column6: yellow; black

column2: 37. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column6: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 38. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column6: no passing zone

column2: 39. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 40. When turning, drivers should:
column4: always move to the right lane.
column6: check traffic in all directions.
column8: increase their speed to improve stability.

column2: 41. This road sign means:
column6: Pedestrian crossing

column2: 42. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a right turn ahead.
column6: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column8: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.

column2: 43. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column6: the center

column2: 44. When turning left at an intersection:
column4: you should never yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column6: you should always yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: oncoming traffic and pedestrians should yield to you.

column2: 45. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column6: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.
column8: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.

column2: 46. This road sign means:
column6: No U-turns
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 47. If you are under 18, to qualify for a probationary license you must:
column4: have no moving traffic convictions in the past 6 months.
column6: have an instruction permit for at least 6 months.
column8: complete and approved driver education course.

column2: 48. Your blind spot is the area of the road:
column4: you see in your side mirror.
column6: you cannot see without moving your head.
column10: you see in your rearview mirror.

column2: 49. This is:
column6: a side road sign.

column2: 50. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column6: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column8: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column10: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
